title: 114_hr737
content: The "Sewage Sludge in Food Production Consumer Notification Act" requires notification to consumers of food products produced on land where sewage sludge has been applied. The Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act is amended to require labeling of food produced on land where sewage sludge was applied, effective one year after the enactment of the Sewage Sludge in Food Production Consumer Notification Act. The Sewage Sludge in Food Production Consumer Notification Act amends the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act to require labeling of food produced on land where sewage sludge was applied. The term 'sewage sludge' is defined in section 503.9(w) of title 40, Code of Federal Regulations. The Sewage Sludge in Food Production Consumer Notification Act requires labeling of food derived from poultry raised on land where sewage sludge was applied, effective one year after enactment. Exceptions include if the sludge application ended over a year before raising the poultry or if the container is labeled accordingly. The Sewage Sludge in Food Production Consumer Notification Act mandates labeling of poultry products from birds raised on land treated with sewage sludge. The term 'sewage sludge' is defined in the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act. Amendments to the Federal Meat Inspection Act address adulterated food. The Sewage Sludge in Food Production Consumer Notification Act requires labeling of livestock products from animals that grazed on land treated with sewage sludge, effective one year after enactment. Exceptions apply if the application of sewage sludge ceased more than a year before grazing began or if the product is clearly labeled. The Sewage Sludge in Food Production Consumer Notification Act mandates labeling of livestock products from animals that grazed on land treated with sewage sludge. Exceptions apply if the application of sewage sludge ceased more than a year before grazing began or if the product is clearly labeled. Additionally, a sign must be posted near carcasses or meat products to inform consumers if the livestock grazed on sludge-treated land or consumed feed from such land. The term "sewage sludge" is defined in accordance with the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act. The Sewage Sludge in Food Production Consumer Notification Act requires labeling of poultry products derived from birds raised on land treated with sewage sludge, effective one year after enactment. Exceptions apply if clearly labeled or if sewage sludge application ceased before raising the poultry. The Sewage Sludge in Food Production Consumer Notification Act mandates labeling of poultry products from birds raised on land treated with sewage sludge, unless clearly labeled or if sludge application ceased before raising the poultry. The Sewage Sludge in Food Production Consumer Notification Act requires labeling of poultry products from birds raised on land treated with sewage sludge. This does not affect the prohibition on sewage sludge use in the National Organic Program. Regulations under the National Organic Program of the Department of Agriculture define sewage sludge as including ash, grit, or screenings generated during sewage treatment.
